intro: Chamaesyce pondii, commonly known as the pond spurge, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, characterized by its milky sap and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows as an annual or short-lived perennial, often found in disturbed soils and along roadsides. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and usually have a waxy coating, while its flowers are inconspicuous and clustered in cyathia. Chamaesyce pondii is adapted to thrive in warm, humid climates and is sometimes considered a weed in agricultural settings.
